intro: Draba himalayensis, commonly known as the Himalayan rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–15 cm, with small, basal leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. Its flowers are usually arranged in racemes and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Draba himalayensis is well adapted to cold climates and is often found in regions with poor soil conditions.
